channel.title: DeObfuscating RuneScape Login Applet
channel.description:
Has anyone ever successfully deobed runescapes java applet located at: [url=http://www.runescape.com/loginapplet/login.ws?mod=www&ssl=0&dest=index.ws]http://www.runescape.com/loginapplet/login.ws?mod=www&ssl=0&dest=index.ws[/url]
[code]<applet class="loginapplet" archive="loginapplet-4da9dce0-1119942563.jar" code="loginapplet.class" height="200" width="400" mayscript> <param name="cabbase" value="loginapplet-26fb3f34.cab?cb=668995011"> <param name="archive" value="loginapplet-4da9dce0-1119942563.jar"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Dsun.java2d.noddraw=true"> <param name="loginurl" value="http://weblogin.runescape.com/login.ws"> <param name="mayscript" value="true"> <param name="lang" value="0"> <param name="dest" value="index.ws"> <param name="mod" value="www"> <param name="where" value="0"> <param name="ssl" value="0"> <param name="remember_me" value="false"> </applet> [/code]

item.title: DeObfuscating RuneScape Login Applet
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The last two posts sum up the position of these forums pretty well. Scammers or attempts at scamming are not welcome.

Locked.

Read full topic

item.title: DeObfuscating RuneScape Login Applet
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Lukeidiot, post:5, topic:248379”]You know scammed is a very strong word. Sure you can call me a scammer for my particular field of coding, but you have to look at it both ways.

You look onto me as Jagex looks onto you. Sure I have have stolen a runescape item, but guess what guys, so have all of you on these forums!

You have stolen Jagex’s stuff (RS Source). And that my friend, is being just as guilty as me taking some pixels in a game.[/quote]
We did not steal anything, we copy/edit/process files that they publicly release. While you remove items from another account and add it to yours.
We don’t hurt people, we don’t destroy children’s live, we just enjoy coding.
I wouldn’t call scamming a particular field of coding, it’s not complicated in anyway to send a username/password to a server.

Btw. we don’t have the runescape source. We only have the compiled version which we process into possible source code.

Read full topic

item.title: DeObfuscating RuneScape Login Applet
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“Lukeidiot, post:5, topic:248379”]You know scammed is a very strong word. Sure you can call me a scammer for my particular field of coding, but you have to look at it both ways.

You look onto me as Jagex looks onto you. Sure I have have stolen a runescape item, but guess what guys, so have all of you on these forums!

You have stolen Jagex’s stuff (RS Source). And that my friend, is being just as guilty as me taking some pixels in a game.

So please guys, try to look at it that way.

On that note, how hard would this applet be to deob? :)[/quote]
Scammer is a strong word, and i used it in its correct context, as “Scamming” is stealing ones property without ones concent, you say that we taking jagex code is stealing, yes it is, however we do not take from them what they cannot get back whereas you steal peoples time and effort in the game, which cannot be repayed.

as pwnd_ stated, you are stealing from people who may be our friends, whereas we “borrow” code from Jagex, and as the rules here state at Moparisthebest.com phishing and password hacking is forbidden, i think you should refresh your knowledge of the rules, and as you are a new member here it would be be a shame to see your membership wasted so soon. now i have seen alot of you before, i used to play a big part in the runescape cheating scene with updating aryan, i was good friends with Nerice, whom you stole updates from which lead him to making his updates private. soon after i started releasing my own version of updates, which you could not steal as i modified field names so that only my closed-source aryan would work. not only did you steal these updates you actually rigged them with keyloggers stealing peoples accounts/gp, now i who have never done that before can be safe to say that what you did was a bad thing, and i would urge you to rethink your ways before breaking out into another epidemic of mass-account stealing from Lukeidiot again.

i do not expect you to read all of this, but if you do then congratulations, you are now a better man.

good day sir.

Read full topic

item.title: DeObfuscating RuneScape Login Applet
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Lukeidiot, post:7, topic:248379”][quote author=shangtsung1 link=topic=327416.msg2563967#msg2563967 date=1228302291]
too hard for a scammer
[/quote]
I’ll sum that up in PHP.
$too hard for a scammer = $_POST[‘doesntknowhowtodoit’];[/quote]Tbh, that’d return an error, idiot.
And PHP is shit.

Also, you steal from ‘peers’, when we steal from the major cooperation!

Read full topic

item.title: DeObfuscating RuneScape Login Applet
item.dc:creator: @Lukeidiot Lukeidiot
item.description:
@Lukeidiot wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:4, topic:248379”][quote author=Original Daniel link=topic=327416.msg2563953#msg2563953 date=1228297543]
Aren’t you that retard who took other people’s updates of aryan and key logged them?
[/quote]
yea he is, he also scammed alot of people for runescape items.
he is a pixel hugger.

why do you think he wants the login applet? to try hack someone, he doesn’t realise jagex would not make it so easy.[/quote]

You know scammed is a very strong word. Sure you can call me a scammer for my particular field of coding, but you have to look at it both ways.

You look onto me as Jagex looks onto you. Sure I have have stolen a runescape item, but guess what guys, so have all of you on these forums!

You have stolen Jagex’s stuff (RS Source). And that my friend, is being just as guilty as me taking some pixels in a game.

So please guys, try to look at it that way.

On that note, how hard would this applet be to deob?

Read full topic
